body:
As always, thanks for the great report. We really appreciate having someone who consistently reports good Windows and mitmweb issues ðŸ˜Š

Regarding the actual issue: This needs to be implemented [here](https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/27353388157adda3d22000fcf146fe599f4f9a6f/web/src/js/flow/utils.js#L58).
Hi, I'd like to work on this. I'm still going through the source code though so some more time would be appreciated. Thanks!

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.title: mitmweb doesn't obey "showhost" directive

repository.name: mitmproxy
repository.description: An interactive TLS-capable intercepting HTTP proxy for penetration testers and software developers.

issue.body:
##### Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Launch mitmweb --host
2. Observe IP addresses in traffic, rather than host

##### Any other comments? What have you tried so far?

mitmproxy with the same option behaves as expected.  That is, host names are used rather than IP addresses.


##### System information

Mitmproxy version: 2.0.0 (release version) 
Python version: 3.5.2
Platform: Linux-3.10.0-514.6.1.el7.x86_64-x86_64-with-centos-7.3.1611-Core
SSL version: OpenSSL 1.0.1e-fips 11 Feb 2013
Linux distro: CentOS Linux 7.3.1611 Core

body: We now default to displaying pretty_host, but we still need to implement the logic to actually consider `--host`.

I know this is closed, but I'm still seeing the issue in the most recent release. If I'm to understand the above comment correctly, mitmweb should now be showing pretty_host all the time, but that's not the case for me.

@mhils @kira0204
Hello everybody, I have the same problem reported in this ticket. Is there anything new?

Thanks
Tess

Hi @tess7,
The issue was fixed as we are using `pretty_host` for now. What is the exact issue you are facing? also do post the output of `mitmproxy --version`, thanks
